{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Curve of Spee is a term used in dentistry to describe the curvature of the mandibular occlusal plane. It is a 3-D curve that extends from the tip of the lower canine, following the buccal cusps of the posterior teeth, continuing to the anterior border of the ramus. The other options, Anti monsoon curve and Monsoon curve, are not related to any 3-D curves in medical or any other scientific context.", "answer_choice": "A"}
